intro: Cheilanthes chusana, commonly known as the rock fern or desert shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. This plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found growing on limestone or sandstone substrates. Cheilanthes chusana is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy and resilient plant in harsh environments.
